turn.0: ELI5 how do corporations get away with “house brands” such as Walmart having Equate products that are “Head and Shoulders” shampoo even comparing themselves to them on the bottle and are cheaper?
turn.1: They “get away” with it because they’re not doing anything illegal. Comparing your product to a competitor is like the basis of advertising. Saying that “our shampoo is comparable to Head and Shoulders” isn’t an infringement of their trademark or any other sort of crime or tort.
turn.2: Ok hear me out, we have product “Dave” here for $5 good product rep, following and/or what not then there’s “Evil Dave” right next to it for $4.29 saying it just like Dave. How’s that not going to piss off Dave.
turn.3: Dave can be as angry as he wants, but he can’t stop them
turn.4: But Dave is losing money, don’t get me wrong I like Dave but Evil Dave is just as good and I’m saving money.
